The European Union and European development banks have launched several funding initiatives to support climate change and energy transition in developing countries. Some of these initiatives are:

1. The European Union's Climate Diplomacy Initiative: This initiative aims to support developing countries in their efforts to mitigate and adapt to climate change. The EU has committed to provide EUR 4.7 billion in funding for this initiative between 2014 and 2020.
2. The European Investment Bank's Climate Action: The European Investment Bank (EIB) has committed to investing at least 25% of its lending portfolio in climate action projects. The EIB also has a Green Bond programme, which raises funds for renewable energy, energy efficiency, and other climate-related projects.
3. The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development's Green Economy Transition: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) has a Green Economy Transition approach that aims to promote sustainable and low-carbon economies in its regions of operation. The EBRD has committed to investing over EUR 30 billion in green investments by 2020.
4. The European Commission's Clean Energy for All Europeans Package: The Clean Energy for All Europeans Package is a set of legislative proposals aimed at accelerating the energy transition in the EU. The package includes funding for clean energy projects in developing countries.
5. The European Union's Global Climate Change Alliance: The Global Climate Change Alliance provides funding for climate change adaptation and mitigation projects in developing countries. The EU has committed to providing EUR 3.4 billion in funding for this initiative between 2014 and 2020.
6. The European Investment Bank's Africa Climate-Resilient Infrastructure Financing Facility: This initiative aims to provide financing for climate-resilient infrastructure projects in Africa. The EIB has committed to providing EUR 2 billion in funding for this initiative between 2018 and 2023.

These are just a few examples of the funding initiatives created by the EU and European development banks to support climate change and energy transition in developing countries.
